TopicTitle: Popular Library on github got hacked

Articles.Content:
I think, this might be relevant for the modding community.

Some very popular coding librarys on github got hacked. I don't know if this is relevsnt for KSP modding and writing plugins, but if so, I think you should be informed. See the link below.

 

Since I am not a programmer or modder, I can't tell if this is relevant for you as a modder, but it might be worth checking if your software builds are affected e.g. if you pull ressources automaticly into your projects.

 

If it is a relevant topic for you, maybe a moderator could pin this. Otherwise just ignore my posting, since I can't tell if the referenced librarys are used in all your fantastic plugins to KSP and your other private dev projects.

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/popular-coa-npm-library-hijacked-to-steal-user-passwords/

Edited November 9, 2021 by Rakete
Fortunately, this is not relevant for KSP modding. NPM is for Javascript, and KSP mods are written in C#.

Alright... good to know.

But maybe this info is relevant for your non-KSP projects...
